channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8684] Table Coprocessor can't access external HTable by default
item.description:
With the default configuration passed to a RegionCoprocessor environment, you cannot reach an HTable on the same cluster (at least in 0.94 - no verified yet in 0.96/8). The reason is in the usage of CompoundConfiguration (backported to 0.94 in HBASE-8176) when loading a table coprocessor we just do (RegionCoprocessorHost, ln 182):


Configuration newConf = new Configuration(conf);

// set per-table cfspec properties

but the conf we pass in a CompoundConfiguration, which means the copy constructor from Configuration doesn't work at all.

So, we really need two things:
1. A test that we can reach another HTable in the same cluster via a coprocessor by default
2. Fixing the configuration creation in RegionCoprocessorHost to support (1)
item.summary: Table Coprocessor can't access external HTable by default

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Attaching patch with the test for CP table access and fixing the configuration creation by adding CompoundConfiguration#deepCopy to get the same functional behavior as the original intention.

Should probably add a test for deepCopy, but I'll do that if people are +1 on the rest.
Oops, also missing a @Category(MediumTests.class) tag on the added test too.

Good catch, Jesse.

Here is patch for trunk.
CompoundConfiguration in trunk supports iterator already. So the patch is much smaller.

+1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12586126/8684-trunk.txt
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 lineLengths. The patch does not introduce lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

This message is automatically generated.

+1
There's a spurious change in HRegion.java, with no real changes in the file
Nit: whitespace in new code in Host

With iterator support, there is no need to introduce CompoundConfiguration.deepCopy()
HBaseConfiguration.create(conf) does the same job.

So it does! I'd prefer to not have the extra pull-in of configs though, so something like:


Configuration newConf = new Configuration(false); //doesn't load any configs

HBaseConfiguration.merge(newConf, conf);

What do you think?
That is fine as well.

Attaching patch for 0.94 that:

  • drops CompoundConfiguration#deepCopy() in favor of HBaseConfiguration#merge
  • backports CompoundConfiguration#iterator from trunk
  • Adds the @Category tag to the test
  • removes the spurious white space added in HRegion
